title: AppUpdatePin Policy
content:
I installed Thunderbird version 115.16.0

I created an enterprise policy file with the following policies:

  • AppAutoUpdate: false
  • AppUpdatePin: "115."
  • BackgroundAppUpdate: false
  • ManualAppUpdateOnly: true

With these policies in place, I expect Thunderbird to only suggest updating to the latest minor.patch version of 115 however as seen in the screenshot it is suggesting that I update to version 128.3.2, which is the next major version.
creator: mozilla649

title: Delete an unwanted nested folder under Local Folders
content: Somehow one of my subfolders under Local Folders became a nested file between the nested Inbox and nested Draft folders (see the uploaded image below). I recreated a new folder under Local Folders and moved all the emails from the 'AA Saved Mail folder to that new folder. Now I cannot find a way to delete the AA Saved Mail folder from its nested position. I've Googled using many different search phrases but came up zero ways to do so. How do I delete that nested folder?
creator: eaglesoaring558

title: DisablePasswordReveal Policy
content:
I installed Thunderbird version 115.16.0

I created an enterprise policy file with the following policies:

  • DisablePasswordReveal: true

With this policy in place, I expect Thunderbird to disable the option to Show Passwords when going to Settings > Privacy and Security > Saved Passwords. However as seen in the screenshot I am able to click on the Show Passwords button; and the passwords are shown along with addtional blank entries that only appear when the Show Passwords button is clicked. The only work-around that I could find to this issue is to also set the following policy:

  • PasswordManagerEnabled: false
creator: mozilla649

title: Loging into Thunderbird
content:

title: Thunderbird Highlighted Text Problem
content:
Thunderbird Highlighted Text Problem After an update of the Thunderbird email program, the text now remains black in a highlighted areas on my main PC. (See Screenshot 1) That makes it difficult to read the text, especially because the blue highlight is actually a bit darker than shown in the screenshot. How can the text be changed back to white in the highlighted area?

I checked the Thunderbird email in my backup PC and the text in highlighted areas is still white. (See Screenshot 2) Most likely that PC’s Thunderbird program missed getting updated because the PC gets seldom turned on.
creator: Opahujo

title: taskbar icon does not indicate when new email is available
content:
Taskbar icon does not indicate when new mail has arrived. Does not show a count of new/unread messages. 128.3.2 Windows 11

In settings "incoming mail" icon options I have chosen "show count of new emails" and "show a tray icon for unread messages is checked".

I am unable to tell at a glance if new email has arrived. I see from researching the KB I'm not the only to have this issue, but none of the settings seem to help.
creator: prestonmeg

title: I want tabs to be restored on reopening. They aren't
content:
After closing, tabs that were open aren't restored as they used to be.

I've read several replies to people asking how to get TB to restore the open tabs, and none of them seem to be solutions. I don't want to use tags, or anything other than for the behaviour that was there and that was useful, to be reinstated.

The only question is:

how to make TB restore open tabs after exiting the software?


Thanks in advance.
creator: musr

title: Alcune cartelle non possono essere compattate
content: Salve, da un pò di tempo ricevo spesso questo messaggio da Thunderbird: " Alcune cartelle (ad esempio "posta in arrivo/posta inviata ) non possono essere compatatte perchè lo spazio sul disco è insufficiente. Eliminare alcuni file e riprovare." Attualmente ho un piano Hosting Netsons SSD 30 - Spazio 30 GB SSD espandibile. Nel contempo alcune mail mi arrivano illeggibili perchè danneggiate e penso che le due cose siano connesse. Cosa fare? Non sono esperta quindi possibilmente vorrei risposte senza termini astrusi. Grazie

title: Cartella Modelli- Non si aprono le mail-modello
content: quando clicco su un modello di mail una finestra dice: "Si è verificato un errore nella finestra di composizione del messaggio. Riprovare più tardi" Inoltre facendo copia e incolla di quel testo, quando incollo appare solo questo testo: ''Per ulteriori informazioni su Dispositivi mobili, consulta lo store. Ho fatto punto di ripristino, ho rinstallato Thunderbirt sul Pc, ma l'errore persiste. Ho infine provato a fare un nuovo modello E QUESTO FUNZIONA. Se ci fosse qualche passaggio semplice per evitare di riscrivere tutti i modelli. Grazie, cordiali saluti, Giorgio Mazzocchi

title: Issues with displaying some messages in Thunderbird
content:
Hi, One of our users had some issues with displaying some messages in Thunderbird. Those messages were shown as some kind of code like on the screenshot attached. This problem did not affect all messages, but only a few that came at a similar time. We’ve found the solution for that issue, by using “Repair Folder” function in folder properties. However, we are trying to diagnose the cause of this problem, as it has already occurred several times, at random times. I prepared such a script based on the information on [https://wiki.mozilla.org/MailNews:Logging#Gecko_Logging] to collect logs:

@echo off set "now=%date:~-4,4%%date:~-10,2%%date:~-7,2%_%time:~0,2%%time:~3,2%%time:~6,2%" set "log_file=%USERPROFILE%\Desktop\TB_logs\log_thunderbird_%now%.moz_log" set MOZ_LOG=IMAP:5,MSGComposition:5,nsStreamConverter:5,MIME:5,timestamp set MOZ_LOG_FILE=%log_file% start "" "%USERPROFILE%\AppData\Local\Mozilla Thunderbird\thunderbird.exe"

However, the amount of logs it generates is too large to realistically analyze them. I am wondering from which modules the logs should be collected and what level of logs should be set for these modules. Please give me your support and suggestions.
creator: ps9347896

title: Gmail messages to Thunderbird
content: I have used Thunderbird for years and have quite a lot of folders with saved emails from previous email server. I have a new gmail account and want to know if those messages can be sent to Thunderbird for reading and saving in my folders?

title: Keyboard shortcut for Reply All not working
content:
This seems to be a recent regression, or perhaps there is some confounding factor on my system. Thunderbird no longer seems to respond to the <Ctrl><Shift>R shortcut to Reply All. The mouse-driven methods of initiating a Reply All still work, and the shortcut is still listed in the Message menu. The normal Reply shortcut <Ctrl>R is working, and all of the other ones that I regularly use still seem to work.

Is this just me? I heavily rely on keyboard navigation for frequently used apps, and have always appreciated Thunderbird's extensive keyboard accessibility.
creator: B.Watkins

title: Thunderbird transfer from computer to computer not getting calendar events
content: I have a new computer and I want to transfer everything in Thunderbird on my old computer to my new one. I did an export, transferred the zip file to the new computer and imported it. All my email accounts showed up which was great. However when I go to my calendar none of the events are shown. Both computers are running Linux. Aren't calendar events exported too?
creator: The_TechnoJunky

title: Issue Accessing Old Emails
content:
Hello,

I have been a Thunderbird user for about 5 years, but recently, I haven't been able to access the old emails I sent.

It seems like they are completely broken. Is there any way to fix them?

Previously, when I clicked on these emails, they would show a blank screen.

After updating the system, I can no longer see my emails from 2-3 years ago.

I would appreciate your support in resolving this issue.

Thank you!
creator: 7526hfyqby
